result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Shackleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Ct signed order. $16.50 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

$443 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KW.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol. May not live anywhere there is alcohol.
Write letter of apology to victim. Provide letter to agent to provide to victim.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kathleen W., John T. or Jack B.

Trial Judge - Br 11

Defendant appeared.  Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
